result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. ALEXIS D. DOYEN

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on December 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant ALEXIS D. DOYEN appeared by video.  Attorney Michael Lim in court for ALEXIS D. DOYEN.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Eric Sparr in court for State of Wisconsin.  Prosecuting attorney Tracy Ann Paider in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court is in compliance with Marsy's Law/Victim Rights.   Waive reading.  Bond continues
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

9:45 AM  Defendant ALEXIS D. DOYEN in court.  Attorney Michael Lim in court for ALEXIS D. DOYEN.  Prosecuting attorney Amanda Lynn Folger in court for the State of Wisconsin. The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law. The Court notes there is no victim present to make a statement. Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed.  Defendant bound over for trial. Bond Continues. Record closed @ 9:51.
Arraignment scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Arraignment on October 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Further proceedings on September 8, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Atty Lim requests more time. Court grants request.The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law. The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement. Court finds good cause to continue waiver of time limits. Record closed @ 857.
Further proceedings scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 11:15 am.

10:02 AM Prosecuting attorney Tracy Ann Paider in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant ALEXIS D. DOYEN not in court.  Attorney Michael Lim in court for ALEXIS D. DOYEN. Atty Lim states DE is currently in treatment. State requesting for proof. Atty Lim to provide proof. Court does not issue a warrant. Bond continues. Record closed 10:05
Further proceedings scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
